content:
# The Stone Furnace has produced 4 iron plates, and there are still 4 iron ore remaining. However, I need at least 5 iron plates to proceed with crafting more advanced items.

# I will need to continue the smelting process to produce at least one more iron plate. Since I have enough coal for fuel, I will insert more iron ore into the furnace to complete the smelting.

insert_item(Prototype.IronOre, furnace, quantity=5)  # Insert 5 more iron ore into the Stone Furnace
print(f"Inventory after inserting more iron ore: {inspect_inventory()}")  # Check inventory after inserting more iron ore

# I will wait again for the smelting process to complete and check the furnace output.
for _ in range(20):  # Maximum wait time of 10 seconds (checking every 0.5 seconds)
    sleep(0.5)  # Wait for the smelting process to continue
    furnace_inventory = inspect_inventory(furnace)
    if furnace_inventory.get(Prototype.IronPlate, 0) >= 5:  # Check if at least 5 iron plates have been produced
        break

# Check inventory and output after waiting
print(f"Furnace inventory after waiting: {inspect_inventory(furnace)}")  # Check furnace output
print(f"Inventory after smelting: {inspect_inventory()}")  # Check overall inventory after smelting
print(f"Entities on the map: {get_entities()}")  # Check entities on the map again
